meanings.definition: A type of shellfish with a ribbed fan-shaped shell.
meanings.sent1: I ordered delicious scallops for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The chef prepared the scallops with a garlic butter sauce.
meanings.sent3: The scallops at the seafood restaurant were so tasty, they seemed to dance on my plate.
meanings.sent4: The scallops on the ocean floor resembled delicate pieces of art.
meanings.sent5: The fresh scent of the ocean filled the room as the scallops sizzled in the pan.

meanings.definition: A series of curved projections forming an ornamental border.
meanings.sent1: The curtains were adorned with scallops along the edges.
meanings.sent2: The invitation had a beautiful design with scallops as the border.
meanings.sent3: The scallops on the curtains seemed to wink playfully in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The scallops on the wallpaper added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent5: The scallops on the cake were meticulously crafted, creating a stunning display.

meanings.definition: To make a decorative edge with curved projections.
meanings.sent1: She carefully scalloped the fabric to create a unique hemline.
meanings.sent2: The baker scallops the pie crust for a beautiful finish.
meanings.sent3: The tailor scalloped the dress, giving it a whimsical touch.
meanings.sent4: The gardener scalloped the hedge, transforming it into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The artist scallops the paper to add texture to the painting.

meanings.definition: To cook seafood by frying quickly in butter or oil.
meanings.sent1: The chef scallops the shrimp in a hot pan.
meanings.sent2: She prefers to scallop the fish rather than bake it.
meanings.sent3: The aroma of scallops cooking filled the kitchen, making everyone's mouth water.
meanings.sent4: The sizzle of scallops in the skillet was music to her ears.
meanings.sent5: He expertly scallops the scallops, ensuring they are perfectly seared on both sides.
